title: Am i the only one who bans bard out

replies.body: I always ban him because I'm afraid of getting baited into a Magical Journey that has an enemy team awaiting me on the other side. D:

Every time a new champion comes out, someone posts this thread.

"Am I the only one who bans [new champion] to keep it off my own team?"

No.  No, you're not.

I'd argue that Bard is different because he has so many mechanisms that can screw his team over if he's played poorly. 

* Wandering to collect chimes without correctly identifying whether it is a good time to wander
* Ulting the enemy team moments before they'd be hit by a strong initiate/cc/damage ability
* Ulting allied team members while they're fleeing ("I'll save you from their damage!!")
* Attempting to use E to escape in the same direction as allied team members (not realizing, perhaps, that the enemy team can follow them)
* Ulting a friendly tower to save it, inadvertently facilitating an enemy dive as surely as if they'd used Ohmwrecker
* Ulting an enemy tower to facilitate a friendly dive, when it was really just a few hits from death

The list goes on. It's mostly his ult, but I have been saved by enemy Bards - and my allied Bards have lost us the game - far, far more than vice-versa.

EDIT: Just played a game where the enemy bard ulted me at very low health, saving me from enemy burst and allowing me to get a clutch kill on their Udyr, freeing Katarina to get a quadrakill.

Solwolf doesn't rig his games with fanboys who "let him win."  They aren't custom games.  He may queue up with some fans, but that has no bearing on the enemy team.  You can't choose your enemy unless it's a custom.  Teambuilder, Draft, and Blind normals are all matchmaking modes.

In some of his videos, he even flat out states that he has had to try multiple times *because his off-meta pick didn't work*.

People couldn't plan for a game on a livestream to be matched against specific opponents.  And if you didn't get your planned opposition?  Would you dodge?  Solwolf didn't.  Dodging until your planned "rigged" match occurred would get you LeaverBuster-slapped with Low Priority Queue status.

Fun fact: being Platinum doesn't mean you're a perfect player.  I've never played a ranked game in my life, but I've beaten Platinum players.  I've also lost to Bronze V players.
